result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frank Bradley Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Frank Bradley Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Frank Bradley Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  Parties remain in trial posture.  Any further motions will be heard on day of trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 11/28/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Received and Filed. Defense's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions

Defendant Frank Bradley Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Frank Bradley Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Frank Bradley in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Josh Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Frank Bradley appeared by video means with Attorney who appeared in person.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel still needs discovery and offer.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel, received and filed.

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
 No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court orders balance to be returned.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  BJC
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Frank Bradley in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 35 for a Pretrial Conference.
Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/25/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7-25-2022 @1p
